pages.text: Schnauzers only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the D Locus. The D Locus is a dilution that turns the fur from black to pepper and salt, a gray coloration with lighter markings.

The D Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'D' and the recessive 'd'. The 'D' allele does not affect the coat's color, while the 'd' allele is a dilute that creates lighter fur. Dogs with one copy of 'd' will carry the dilution trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for diluted pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 'd' will always create either dilute carriers or diluted puppies.
pages.title: D Locus
